Context:
Program Name: Human Resources Management
Code: B408
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 12 months (2 semesters in-class, 1 semester work experience)
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,377.00 *
International Tuition: $18,295.00 **
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Work Experience (Co-op or Internship) Required
Program Description: The Human Resources Management program integrates business theory and practical application to prepare students for various HR positions such as human resources generalist or coordinator, recruiter, compensation analyst, or learning and development coordinator. Students gain insider knowledge from experienced HR professionals, learn about HR department functions, promoting diversity, creating HR policies and programs, and get real-world experience through a field placement.

* Domestic tuition fee for the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 academic years.
** International tuition fee for the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 academic years.

Programs related to Human Resources Management: International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411), Business – Human Resources (B134), Project Management (Postgraduate) (B415)
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Human Resources Management Program (Postgraduate) B408 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The Human Resources Management program at the Centre for Business in the School of Human Resources offers students the ability to gain skills in facilitating employee training and development, ensuring health and safety in the workplace, recruiting and hiring employees, recommending strategic change initiatives, and developing a total rewards system. For those students seeking the Certified Human Resources Professional designation (CHRP), all applicable courses are HRPA approved and prepare students to write the National Knowledge Exam offered by the Human Resources Professionals Association (HRPA). The program is also offered in a fully online format, with students applying under B428. The work experience requirement for graduation consists of one semester of co-op or internship work. Graduates can enter various positions across public and private sector organizations, including human resources generalist, recruiter, learning and development coordinator, compensation analyst, and human resources coordinator. An optional Training and Development Stream is available for students seeking further knowledge and practical experience, which may lead to the Certified Training and Development Professional Designation (CTDP) offered through the Institute of Performance and Learning.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Human Resources Management Program (Postgraduate) B408 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The B408 program at the college requires students to complete 15 mandatory courses and one work experience term in order to graduate. The following is a list of the courses and their respective semesters:

Semester 1:
- ACCT 4005: Financial and Managerial Accounting (no co-requisite)
- BUS 4017: Project Management (no co-requisite)
- HRM 4003: Human Resource Management (no co-requisite)
- HRM 4004: Organizational Effectiveness (no co-requisite)
- HRM 4005: Recruitment and Selection (no co-requisite)
- HRM 4008: Training and Development (no co-requisite)

Semester 2:
- HRM 4009: Compensation (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4010: Labour Relations and Collective Agreements (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4011: Employment and Human Rights Law (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4012: Human Resources Planning (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4013: Occupational Health and Safety (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4015: HR Seminar Series (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- HRM 4031: People Analytics (pre-requisite: HRM 4003)
- BUS 4000: Work Experience Prep Course (no co-requisite)

Students may also complete a work experience term, either through Co-op, Internship or BAWT streams. Students who wish to gain further knowledge and practical experience in training and development may pursue an optional stream in this area. Upon successful completion of the Training and Development Stream, students may choose to pursue the Certified Training and Development Professional Designation (CTDP) offered through The Institute of Performance and Learning.

Students can apply for course exemptions from recognized universities with a minimum grade of 70 per cent and HRPA approved courses where applicable. The college's applicable HR courses have been approved by the Human Resources Professional Association of Ontario (HRPA).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Human Resources Management Program (Postgraduate) B408 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Name: Certified Training and Development Professional Designation (CTDP)
Courses: HRM 4008 - Training & Development, HRM 2028 - Training Design & Delivery, HRM 4003 - Coaching for Effective Performance Management, HRM 4008 (repeat), HRM 2027 - Coaching for Effective Performance Management
Program Learning Outcomes: The graduate demonstrates the ability to:
1. Contribute to the development, implementation and evaluation of employee recruitment, selection and retention plans and processes.
2. Administer and contribute to the design and evaluation of the performance management program.
3. Develop, implement and evaluate employee orientation, training and development programs.
4. Facilitate and support effective employee and labour relations in both non-union and union environments.
5. Research and support the development and communication of the organization’s total compensation plan.
6. Collaborate with others in the development, implementation and evaluation of organizational health and safety policies and practices.
7. Research and analyze information needs and apply current and emerging information technologies to support the human resources function.
8. Develop, implement and evaluate organizational development strategies aimed at promoting organizational effectiveness.
9. Present and evaluate communication messages and processes related to the human resources function of the organization.
10. Manage own professional development and provide leadership to others in the achievement of ongoing competence in human resources professional practice.
11. Facilitate and communicate the human resources component of the organization’s business plan.
12. Conduct research, produce reports and recommend changes in human resources practices.
Tuition & Fees:
Domestic Students: $4,377.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2023)
International Students: $18,295.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2023)
Note: Tuition fees are subject to board approval and are estimated based on prior years. All fees are subject to change without notice. This fee does not include books, which are to be purchased by the student separately.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Human Resources Management Program (Postgraduate) B408 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
* This program includes one work experience semester.
* There is an additional fee of $500 for each work experience semester.
* The tuition fee does not include the cost of the work experience semester.
* This program is approved for OSAP funding.
* Applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English proficiency test results must test at the college level in the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission.
* Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* Information sessions are held on a regular basis.
* For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.
* For international student inquiries, contact one of the international recruitment representatives or visit the International Contact Us page.
* For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.
